title: MAFS couple in cheating scandal
text:
Share on Twitter 
CHANNEL Nine has confirmed a major cheating twist is set to disrupt the honeymoon of at least one couple on Married At First Sight. 
A spokesman told news.com.au that “there is a cheating scandal” and that the action would “come to life on Sunday night”. 
However, they refused to reveal which contestants were involved. 
The news comes amid reports in The Daily Telegraph that the scandal involves the first strangers to walk down the aisle, Gold Coast hairdresser Cheryl and “entrepreneur” Jonathan . 
The Telegraph reports that the couple became caught up in a revenge cheating drama, with Cheryl going “crazy” after catching him hitting on someone else. 
“He gives one of the other women his number and when Cheryl finds out, things get ugly,” the article states. 
According to the publication, Cheryl then calls upon the time-honoured tradition of a revenge hook-up — and sets her sights on fellow contestant Andrew, who we last saw being abandoned by his “bride” Lauren. 
The Nine spokesman has distanced the network from this story, labelling it purely “speculative”.
